title: JavaScript
content:
JavaScript
  • Used to give functionality to HTML elements
  • var means variable, used to store data
  • If a form field is empty, this function alerts a message, and returns false, to prevent the form from being submitted
  • JS can be put in the <head>, <body>, and in a separate page that can be called <script src="myScript1.js"></script>
JavaScript DOM Object
  • When a page is loaded the browser creates a Document Object Model of the page
  • With the object model, JavaScript gets all the power it needs to create dynamic HTML
  • Defines HTML elements as objects
Objects VS Arrays
  • Objects use named indexes
  • Use objects when you want element names to be strings
  • Arrays use numbered indexes
  • Use arrays when you want element names to be numbers
Common Objects
  • Strings: var carname = "Volvo XC60";
  • Math: Math.random(), Math.ceil(), Math.floor()
  • For loops, while loops, if and else if loops
